raw_comment: I noticed that most countries seem to have more teenagers/young adults who think the world is getting better than people over 40. I wonder what reason this is for, is it more confidence in one’s own race, or is there another reason for this trend? This relates to my community because I am in the age range for that first group, being a teenager. A good headline could be “most young adults have more confidence in newer generations that older adults.” I know it’s long, but this is a strange graph to find a headline for.
ace_sentences: In most countries, many teenagers and young adults think that the world is getting better.
In most countries, many people over 40 do not think that the world is getting better.
I wonder about the reason for this trend.
One possible reason is that young people have more confidence in their own race.
This trend relates to my community.
I am in the age range of the first group.
A possible headline is: Most young adults have more confidence in newer generations than older adults.
It is difficult to find a headline for this graph.
